feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission clearly implements a functioning financial application: it uses finance APIs (Alpha Vantage, insider transactions), runs agent analyses on stock volume/news/insider activity, and produced specific findings (Carvana check and Beyond Meat insider dumps). Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages collectively show practical financial functionality rather than just a conceptual idea.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission clearly integrates an AI-agent architecture conceptually and provides demo examples (Carvana, Beyond Meat) showing the agents producing actionable findings, so AI adds value. However, technical details of the AI integration (models, decision logic, or how agents coordinate) are limited and reliance on a finance API is emphasized, so the treatment is correct but not sufficiently thorough for a full PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: ["the mission here is to find insider training."]
["All of these agents use um Alpha Vantage. Uh it's a finance API and it's the free tier."]

["Yeah, this was Beyond Meat. So, uh Beyond Meat, he found that every boss and executive um basically dumped shares just before... He basically said there might have been some insider trading going on here."]
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: defines mission to find insider trading. 
Implement: demonstrates use of Alpha Vantage and a demo of agents analyzing stock data. 
Reflect: presents concrete findings/examples (Carvana demo and Beyond Meat insider trades) showing financial outputs.
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly implements a functioning financial application: it uses finance APIs (Alpha Vantage, insider transactions), runs agent analyses on stock volume/news/insider activity, and produced specific findings (Carvana check and Beyond Meat insider dumps). Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages collectively show practical financial functionality rather than just a conceptual idea.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I created the insider trading task force and to do this uh I used a new um theory that I haven't used before in this class and it's called the AI agent swarm. So basically we have a chief AI agent who instructs other agents who have specialized tasks to complete a mission."
"All of these agents use um Alpha Vantage. Uh it's a finance API and it's the free tier. Um and yeah, so let me just demo how it works."
"He basically said there might have been some insider trading going on here."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student defines the mission and introduces the "AI agent swarm" concept.  
Implement: student demos the agents interacting and states they use Alpha Vantage for data.  
Reflect: student reflects on a past finding (Beyond Meat) where the agents suggested possible insider trading.
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly integrates an AI-agent architecture conceptually and provides demo examples (Carvana, Beyond Meat) showing the agents producing actionable findings, so AI adds value. However, technical details of the AI integration (models, decision logic, or how agents coordinate) are limited and reliance on a finance API is emphasized, so the treatment is correct but not sufficiently thorough for a full PASS.
